identificationModule.briefTitle: From Clinic to Community: An Information and Communication Technology (ICT) Home-Based Exercise Training System for Translating Clinical Findings
identificationModule.officialTitle: Dose-Response Effects of Transformative Exercise in Improving Health and Function in Adults With Spinal Cord Injury and Multiple Sclerosis

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The specific aim of the study in our example is to conduct a feasibility translational home-based exercise trial established in the LEADERS (R2) project with the TExt-ME tele-exercise training system for participants with neurologic disability. We hypothesize that participants in this home-based tele-exercise training program will achieve similar gains in health and function outcomes as the onsite exercise training program. Further, there will be no difference in adverse side effects (safety) between the home-based and onsite exercise treatment groups.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
TExT-ME is a home-based tele-exercise study providing a novel exercise program to participants with neurologic disabilities. The exercise curriculum is a Movement 2 Music (M2M) program developed during phase 2 of the grant (clinicaltrials.gov identifier NCT02533882). The exercise exercise classes are taught by trained dance instructors and are composed of a set of exercises tailored to the specific needs and capabilities of adults with neurologic disability. Each set of exercises is performed to high and low tempo music based on the individual's baseline level of function, with adjustments made to increase or decrease intensity if needed. The class consists of several training components: a) warmup (10 min.) to increase range of motion; strength/balance (15-20 min), aerobics (25-30 min. with rest periods as necessary); cool down (5 min).

The TExT-ME training and monitoring system is a user-centered design (UCD) involving a tele-exercise coach (e.g., a trained research staff person) interacting remotely with a participant in their home using video conferencing programs. Participants wear monitors to maintain safe levels of exercise and provide feedback regarding exercise intensity to the instructors. Self-reported indicators of exercise intensity are also collected using rating of perceived exertion.

armGroups.label: Home-Based Movement to Music
armGroups.description: The Movement to Music classes are composed of a set of exercises tailored to the specific needs and capabilities of each target group. The class will consist of and aerobic component and a strength component performed to varying music tempos. All movements will be choreographed by qualified dance instructors. Intervention is delivered using video-conferencing to connect the participant to their instructor.

interventions.name: Movement to Music
interventions.description: The Movement to Music classes are composed of a set of exercises tailored to the specific needs and capabilities of each target group. The class will consist of and aerobic component and a strength component performed to varying music tempos. All movements will be choreographed by qualified dance instructors. Intervention is delivered using video-conferencing to connect the participant to their instructor.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Cardiorespiratory Fitness as measured by sub-maximal VO2
primaryOutcomes.description: Submax VO2 is assessed by the six minute walk test or the six minute push test. Participants wear a portable metabolic cart while walking or pushing

primaryOutcomes.measure: Pain as measured by PROMIS Pain Interference Short Form 8a
primaryOutcomes.description: PROMIS Pain Interference Short Form 8a Questionnaire

primaryOutcomes.measure: Fatigue as measured by PROMIS Fatigue Short Form 8a
Grip Strength as measured by hand grip dynamometer
primaryOutcomes.description: Participants exert as much force as possible using a Jamar hand grip dynamometer

primaryOutcomes.measure: Strength as measured by Biodex System 3 Multijoint dynamometer
primaryOutcomes.description: Upper body strength is measured using a closed chain push/pull protocol. Lower body strength is measured using the knee flexion/extension protocol.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Balance as measured by the Timed Up and Go
primaryOutcomes.description: The Timed to Up and Go test is performed using a chair with arms. The participants stand up from the chair, walk to a mark measured three meters from the chair then return back to the seat. A score of greater than or equal to 14 seconds (average) has been shown to indicate a high risk of falling.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Balance as measured by Biodex Limits of Stability
primaryOutcomes.description: The Limits of Stability test is performed on the Biodex SD balance machine using the limits of stability protocol created by Biodex.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Balance as measured by Repeated Chair Stands
primaryOutcomes.description: The repeated chair stands test is performed by asking participants to stand up and sit down 5 times as fast as possible. A score of greater than or equal to 14 seconds (average) has been shown to indicate a high risk of falling.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Walking velocity as measured by the GaitRite
primaryOutcomes.description: 20 meter walk is completed on the GaitRite mat

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Health Biomarkers as measured by blood analysis (insulin)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Participants undergo a fasted blood draw to assess insulin

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Health Biomarkers as measured by blood analysis (lipids)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Participants undergo a fasted blood draw to assess lipids

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Health Biomarkers as measured by blood analysis (fasting glucose)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Participants undergo a fasted blood draw to assess glucose
height and weight are assessed to compute BMI

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Circumference measurements to be reported as composite ratios (waist circumference, hip circumference, neck circumference)
secondaryOutcomes.description: circumference measures are completed at the neck, hip, and waist. Waist to hip ratios are computed (A/G ratio)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Physical Function with Mobility Aid as measured by PROMIS Physical Function with Mobility Aid 455b
secondaryOutcomes.description: PROMIS Physical Function with Mobility Aid 455b questionnaire

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Anxiety as measured by PROMIS Emotional Distress-Anxiety Short Form 8a
secondaryOutcomes.description: PROMIS Emotional Distress-Anxiety Short Form 8a questionnaire

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Depression as measured by PROMIS Emotional Distress-Depression Short Form 8a
secondaryOutcomes.description: PROMIS Emotional Distress-Depression Short Form 8a questionnaire

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Sleep Disturbance as measured by PROMIS Sleep Disturbance Short Form 8a
secondaryOutcomes.description: PROMIS Sleep Disturbance Short Form 8a questionnaire

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Ability to participate in social roles and activities as measured by PROMIS Ability to Participate in Social Roles and Activities Short Form 8a
secondaryOutcomes.description: PROMIS Ability to Participate in Social Roles and Activities Short Form 8a questionnaire

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Nutrition Self-Efficacy as measured by the Nutrition Self-Efficacy Scale
Physical Exercise Self-Efficacy as measured by the Physical Exercise Self Efficacy Scale
Pain intensity is measured by the PROMIS Pain Intensity Short Form
secondaryOutcomes.description: PROMIS Pain Intensity Short Form questionnaire

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Body Composition as measured using a DEXA scan
secondaryOutcomes.description: GE Lunar Dual X-ray Absorptiometry is used to assess total body composition

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Loneliness as measured by the Three-item loneliness scale

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Diagnosed with stroke
* MS - mild to moderate disability (Patient Determined Disease Steps Score 0-6)
* Able to use arms or arm/legs for exercise
* Ambulatory or use manual wheelchair

Exclusion Criteria:

* Cognitive impairment (Mini-Mental State Exam score \< 24)
* Recent weight change (+/- 25 pounds in 1 year)
* Poorly controlled blood pressure
* Cardiovascular disease event within the past six months
* Severe pulmonary disease
* Renal failure
* Current tobacco user or quit within the last six months
* Current use of medications for psychosis
* Active pressure ulcers

references.citation: Rimmer JH, Herman C, Wingo B, Fontaine K, Mehta T. Methodological and clinical implications of a three-in-one Russian doll design for tracking health trajectories and improving health and function through innovative exercise treatments in adults with disability. BMC Med Res Methodol. 2018 Mar 14;18(1):28. doi: 10.1186/s12874-018-0480-3.
